page.title: 12FOOD IN BUCKLAND BREWER
page.content: { BREAKFAST ONLY 4% OF THE CHILDREN EAT THE TRADITIONAL ENGLISH BREAKFAST OF FRIED EGG, BACON, SAUSAGES, TOMATOES AND BREAD. 69% EAT SOME KIND OF CEREAL WITH MILK AND SUGAR ON IT AND 75% EAT BREAD OR TOAST WITH BUTTER AND SOME KIND OF SPREAD SUCH AS HONEY, MARMALADE OR JAM. { MID-DAY MEAL} A TYPICAL MAIN MEAL IS MADE UP EITHER OF SAUSAGES, COLD COOKED MEATS OR PIE EATEN WITH POTATOES, EITHER CHIPPED OR MASHED, AND PEAS OR SALAD. 46% OF CHILDREN HAVE A SUNDAY ROAST DINNER WHICH CAN BE BEEF, LAMB, CHICKEN OR PORK. THE MEATS ARE EATEN WITH SPROUTS, CARROTS, CABBAGE, PEAS, BEANS AND POTATOES. ADULTS SOMETIMES DRINK WINE AND CHILDREN DRINK FIZZY POP.
